meanings.definition: To bury (a dead body) in the ground.
meanings.sent1: The family decided to inhume their beloved pet in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: It is customary to inhume deceased family members in the cemetery.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to inhume its toy mouse in the sandbox.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the past can sometimes inhume our present happiness.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tradition of inhuming the deceased has been practiced for centuries.

meanings.sent1: The archaeologists carefully inhumed the artifacts they found at the site.
meanings.sent2: In many cultures, it is common to inhume important documents for future generations.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to inhume its acorn treasure in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The secrets of the past are often inhumed in the depths of history.
meanings.sent5: The old tree seemed to inhume the sunlight with its dense foliage.
